result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Lyne Mickey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenneth Lyne Mickey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenneth Lyne Mickey was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Kenneth Lyne Mickey was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply.
*PROBATION REVIEW HEARING January 22, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. in BR. 40.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable court costs, fees and domestic surcharges during period of probation. If not paid during probation, to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay all appropriate costs, if not already paid, to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Have no VIOLENT contact with Gwendolyn M.
No illegal drug or alcohol.

Attend and complete batterer's intervention.
Referred to mental health unit of probation.
Take all prescribed medication.

AODA assessment and treatment.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens AT LEAST ONCE A MONTH.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED, to be used at discretion of Probation Agent/until next court date 9-25-15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Lyne Mickey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Per Order signed on 11/18/15: " Defendant cannot vote and as a convicted felon may not possess a firearm".  
Correction: those statement should be eliminated from the Judgement of Conviction.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Count two per review hrg of 9/25/2015.

Defendant Kenneth Lyne Mickey in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 5 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded as to Count THREE: 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 DAYS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 44 days time served.   NO  Huber privileges .

Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and domestice surcharges to be paid by 6-17-2017 or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Kenneth Lyne Mickey in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is being heard for branch 40, Judge Dallet. 
As to Count TWO: 

 Defendant sentenced to serve NINE MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for zero  days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of two years.
Conditions: 

-Defendant to serve 30 DAYS  in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence, STAYED, to be used at discretion of Probation Agent/until next court date 9-25-15
-AODA assessment and treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drug or alcohol.
-Random urine screens AT LEAST ONCE A MONTH.
-attend and complete batterer's intervention .  
-referred to mental health unit of probation
-take all prescribed medication
-Have no  VIOLENT contact with Gwendolyn M.  
-Pay all applicable court costs , fees and domestic surcharges during period of probation.  If not paid during probation, to be docketed as a civil judgment.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay all appropriate costs, if not already paid, to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to dismiss Count 1 is granted by the Court without prejudice.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Kenneth Lyne Mickey in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Kenneth Lyne Mickey in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On motion of the state, Court ordered Count 2 be amended to reflect the date of 3/15/15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kenneth Lyne Mickey not in court, in custody.  Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/01/15 in Branch 40.  On motion of the state, Court ordered 14CM4844 and 15CM1268 joined for the purpose of trial.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kenneth Lyne Mickey not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail hearing waived.  Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Gwendolyn M.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kenneth Lyne Mickey in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Kenneth Lyne Mickey in custody.  
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40 due to lower pending case 14CM4844.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  

Defendant request a Speedy trial.  
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
